Container.Name: QuakeLive
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Quake Live and run it. Initial ServerName: 'Quake Live Docker' and Password: 'Docker' (without quotes)
ATTENTION: First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.
You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!

Config.Name: GAME_ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container download at startup. (https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

Config.Name: GAME_PARAMS
Config.Description: Enter your start up commands for the server.

Config.Name: Steam-Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Validate Installation
Config.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

Config.Name: Steam-Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: UDP1 - Gameport
Config.Description: UDP Game Port (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change it in the server.cfg)

Config.Name: TCP1 - RCON Port
Config.Description: TCP RCON Port (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new TCP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change it in the server.cfg)
